unit_learning_outcomes.description: communicate and devise plans for performance experiments that actively engage with media technologies.
analyse the utilisation of media technologies by arts practitioners to achieve engagement and distribution goals in the performing arts industries.
evaluate the influence of media technologies and digital platforms on the performing arts and entertainment industries.
interpret developments in contemporary performance practices that deal with questions of human-technology relationships in their wider social, cultural, and artistic contexts.

assessments.description: Students conduct group performance experiments that actively engage with media technologies. Each student discusses their individual idea for the performance experiment in a detailed written plan that corresponds to a realised performance. Refer to iLearn for further information.

Students research and discuss examples that illustrate the influence of media technologies on digital performance practices and in the performing arts industries. The student report should research key ideas and issues from course content and readings. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: The performing arts and entertainment industries engage with emerging media and social media technologies as tools for marketing and promotion. Students will experiment with various media technologies as they relate to the performing arts and entertainment industries, and in doing so encourage students to create future visions for how the industry will engage audiences.
data.title: Digital Performance Strategies
